heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest strike happened on 13 May 2025, a distance of just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 07 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (190°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.1°C) and outside temperature (down 1.8°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 3896 lux) and cloud levels (up 172 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 3553 lux) and cloud levels (up 109 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 171.9m lower than yesterday, 361.3m higher than the past week, 109.3m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 928m minimum and 5160m maximum, with an average of 2360m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 2000m and 2470m.
cloud levels.summary: The sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; warm but comfortable temperatures are expected. Also, humidity should not be a concern and calm and still conditions are expected. Possible light showers, the sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine, and periods of sunshine are expected. Weather could become unsettled.
